subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Implementation for an already developed J2EE application
msgSnippet: Praveen, Have you had experience that backs up this conclusion?  In my experience, one is much better off working to get one test in place at a time on the
messageBody:
Praveen,

Have you had experience that backs up this conclusion? In my
experience, one is much better off working to get one test in place at a
time on the existing code base, as encouraged in Michael Feathers'
_Working Effectively with Legacy Code_.

David Saff

Praveen AH wrote:

> Hi Pramod,
>
> My suggestion is redevelopment of the application with the test driven
> development approach would be the best solution.
>
> Regards,
> Praveen
>
>
>
>
> Pramod Kumar <pramod.kumar@...> wrote:
> Hi '
>
> Can any one tell me what would be the best approach to implement the
> Junit testcases
> for an already developed J2EE application. I fear that it would be a
> redevelopment as we
> have to write TestCase classes for all the existing classes( Units ).Is
> redevelopment
> of the application with the test driven development approach would be
> the best solution or
> we can implement the JUnit test cases for already exsisting application
> ? Please reply.
>
> Regards
> Pramod
>
>
>
>
>
